channel.title: Carnegie Mellon University Innovation in Healthcare Technology Conference

item.title: Keynote Speakers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Rasu Shrestha

Dr. Rasu Shrestha is the medical director of digital imaging informatics at UPMC who is focusing on the relationship between radiology (and other -oligy specialities) and information services to be implemented with the use of EMRs.  Dr. Shrestha will focus on the necessary synergy between health information technology and clinicians to provide a more patient-centric approach in healthcare.  Dr. Shrestha will address the benefits and barriers presented in implementing health IT in conjunction to the necessary changes that need to be made in today’s healthcare systems.

Don DeLauder

Don DeLauder, Executive Director of Corporate Innovation at Medrad, a leading medical device manufacturer focused on computed tomography, magnetic resonance, and cardiovascular applications, will provide a look into the future of the medical device industry. Mr. DeLauder will discuss future health care innovations, their impact on patients, and the barriers (e.g., regulations, product costs) and facilitators (ie. greater focus on customer centricity) to developing these devices. The address will conclude with recommendations for how innovators can achieve success in this future state.

item.title: Agenda
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
9:00am-9:30am Registration and Continental Breakfast
University Center, Rangos 1, 2, and 3
9:30am-9:45am Welcome
University Center, Rangos 1, 2, and 3
10:45am-11:15am Break
11:15am-12:30pm Concurrent Panels: Medical Devices and Health Care IT
Moving Medical Devices Beyond Its Current Capabilities to Drive High Quality, Low Cost Care
Hamburg Hall, Room 1000
  • Moderator:
  • Christine Robbins, CEO, Body Media
  • Doug Ladd, Ethicon Endo Surgery
Moving HIT Beyond Its Current Capabilities to Drive Improved Patient Outcomes
Posner Hall, Room 153
  • Moderator:
  • Eric Dahlem, Managing Director, Business Transformation Process, SDLC Partners
  • Mary Anne Darragh, VP of Health Management Services, Highmark
  • Assaf Halevy, Co-Founder and VP of Strategic Accounts and Business Development, dB Motion
  • Jay Srini, Chief Strategist, SCS Ventures
12:30pm-1:00pm Break
1:00pm-2:30pm Lunch and Entrepreneurship Panel
University Center, Rangos 1, 2, and 3
  • Moderator: Jim Jordan, Chief Investment Officer, Pittsburgh Life Sciences Greenhouse
  • Hank Werronen, PHQL
  • Adam Simone (MSBTM, 2011), Blue Belt Technologies
  • Steve Fleck, Clear Count
2:30pm-2:45pm Break
2:45pm-3:45pm Keynote, Don DeLauder, Executive Director, Corporate Innovation, Medrad
University Center, Rangos 1, 2, and 3
3:45pm-4:00pm Concluding Remarks
University Center, Rangos 1, 2, and 3
4:00pm-5:00pm Networking Reception
Posner Center

item.title: Panels
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Moving Medical Devices Beyond Its Current Capabilities to Drive High Quality Low Cost Care

Technological advancement has been cited as a key driver of health care costs. This panel will discuss whether innovation in medical devices can improve efficiency and decrease systemic costs by improving the effectiveness of care, increasing patient engagement, and transforming health care providers’ business models.

Panelists:

  • Eric Dahlem, Managing Director, Business Transformation Process, SDLC Partners
  • Mary Anne Darragh, VP of Health Management Services, Highmark
  • Assaf Halevy, Co-founder and VP of Strategic Accounts and Business Development, dB Motion
  • Jay Srini, Chief Strategist, SCS Ventures

Moving HIT Beyond Its Current Capabilities to Drive Improved Patient Outcomes

The Health IT field is continually growing to allow the sharing of patient information among healthcare providers in order to improve patient outcomes and decrease inefficiencies in care.  This panel will discuss the latest innovative Health IT solutions for more integrated healthcare and how they view this transition taking place.  The panelists will also provide insight on how the advancements in Health IT will serve consumers and end-users.

Panelists:

  • Christine Robbins, CEO, Body Media

Building opportunities during uncertain economic and regulatory transition

These panelists represent start-up companies at various stages of funding and product development. After providing a brief overview of their company and business model, the panelists will discuss the challenges and opportunities arising from the economic downturn and increased regulation for entrepreneurs.

Panelists:

  • Hank Werronen (GSIA, ), PHQL
  • Adam Simone (MSBTM, 2011), Blue Belt Technologies
  • Steve Fleck, Clear Count  (still waiting confirmation)

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi, this is a comment.
To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickies to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Realizing the Future of Health Care
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Increasing health care costs and demand for health care services resulting from an aging and ailing population has made health care unaffordable and has undermined US businesses’ competitiveness in the global economy. Recently enacted health reforms aim to increase access to health care, decrease costs, and improve the quality of care. Innovation in health care technology—ranging from the implementation and use of HIT to the development of new medical devices—will change business models, improve efficiencies, and prove critical to the advancement of low cost, high quality health care. This conference will explore the role of innovation in health care technology in achieving an improved health care system.

item.title: Directions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Getting to Campus

The conference will be held on Carnegie Mellon University's campus in Pittsburgh and will be split between the University Center (denoted by the green arrow on the map below), Hamburg Hall, and Posner Hall. The University Center is located at 5000 Forbes Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15232. View Larger Map

Parking

Parking is available in a garage next to the University Center at the intersection of Forbes and Beeler.

Getting Around Campus

Hamburg Hall, home to the J. Heinz College, is located on Forbes Ave between S. Neville St and Morewood Ave. Posner Hall, home to the Tepper School of Business, is located at the corner of  Tech St and Frew St. Please see the Carnegie Mellon University campus map for details about how to get around campus. Hamburg Hall is building 11, Posner Hall is building 19, and the University Center is building 29. The recommended parking garage is labeled P7.
